In the diagram, PQRS is a circle with centre O and radius 7cm. SQ and PR intersect at K and < SKR = 90°. If the length of the arc SR is four times that of arc PQ, find the length of the arc SR. [Take \(\pi = \frac{22}{7}\)].
correct_answer:
Let < POQ = \(\theta\)
\(\implies\) SR = \(4\theta\).
\(< PSQ = \frac{\theta}{2} ; < SPR = 2\theta\)
In \(\Delta PSK\),
\(2\theta + \frac{\theta}{2} = 90°\)
\(\frac{5\theta}{2} = 90° \implies 5\theta = 180°\)
\(\theta = \frac{180°}{5} = 36°\)
\(\therefore < SOR = 4\theta = 4 \times 36° = 144°\)
Length of arc = \(\frac{\theta}{360°} \times 2\pi r\)
\(\frac{144}{360} \times 2 \times \frac{22}{7} \times 7 \)
= \(17.6 cm\).

text:
In the diagram, PQT is a straight line and SQ // RT.

(a) Join QR and show that : (i) < RPS = < QRT ; (ii) < PRS = < QTR.
(b) ABC is a triangle. The sides AB and AC are produced to D and E respectively such that < DBC = 132° and < ECD = 96°. Show that \(\Delta\) ABC is isosceles.
correct_answer:
(a) < QRT = < RQS (alternate angles)
< RPS = < RQS (angles in the same segment)
\(\therefore\) < RPS = < QRT
(ii) < QRT = < PQS (corresponding angles)
< PQS = < PRS (angles in the same segment)
\(\therefore\) < QTR = < PRS.
(b) \(< ABC = \hat{B} = 180° - 132° = 48°\)
\(< ACB = \hat{C} = 180° - 96° = 84°\)
\(< BAC = \hat{A} = 180° - (48° + 84°) = 48°\)
\(< BAC = < ABC = 48°\)
\(\therefore \Delta ABC = isosceles\).
explanation:
(a) < QRT = < RQS (alternate angles)
< RPS = < RQS (angles in the same segment)
\(\therefore\) < RPS = < QRT
(ii) < QRT = < PQS (corresponding angles)
< PQS = < PRS (angles in the same segment)
\(\therefore\) < QTR = < PRS.
(b) \(< ABC = \hat{B} = 180° - 132° = 48°\)
\(< ACB = \hat{C} = 180° - 96° = 84°\)
\(< BAC = \hat{A} = 180° - (48° + 84°) = 48°\)
\(< BAC = < ABC = 48°\)
\(\therefore \Delta ABC = isosceles\).
